sections.title: Measuring Orientation and Acceleration
sections.content: The IMU is a sensor that measures the robot's orientation (angle) and acceleration. It is essential for advanced autonomous navigation and maintaining heading.

sections.title: IMU Facts
sections.subtitle: What does the IMU do?
items: Used for gyro-based turning and field-oriented control

sections.title: IMU Initialization Example
Applications
sections.content: Use the IMU for precise turns, maintaining heading, and advanced autonomous routines.
